contentrichtext.text: '''Baron Moran''', of Manton in the County of Wiltshire, is a title in the [[Peerage of the United Kingdom]]. It was created on 8 March 1943 for the physician [[Charles Wilson, 1st Baron Moran|Charles Wilson]] (10 Nov 1882 - 12 Apr 1977). He is chiefly remembered as [[Winston Churchill|Winston Churchill's]] personal physician during the [[Second World War]] and was President of the [[Royal College of Physicians]] from 1941 to 1949. As of 2012 the title is held by his eldest son, the second Baron, who succeeded in 1977. He is a retired diplomat and has notably served as [[British Ambassador to Hungary]] and [[British Ambassador to Portugal|Portugal]] and as [[British High Commissioner to Canada]] from 1981 to 1984. Lord Moran is also one of the ninety elected [[hereditary peer]]s that remain in the [[House of Lords]] after the passing of the [[House of Lords Act 1999]], and sits as a [[crossbencher]]. ==Barons Moran (1943)== *[[Charles Wilson, 1st Baron Moran|Charles McMoran Wilson, 1st Baron Moran]] (1882â€“1977) *[[John Wilson, 2nd Baron Moran|(Richard) John McMoran Moran Wilson, 2nd Baron Moran]] (b. 1924) The [[heir apparent]] is the present holder's son the Hon. James McMoran Wilson (b. 1952) The heir apparent's heir apparent is his son David Andrew McMoran Wilson (b. 1990) ==Notes== {{Reflist|2}} ==References== *Kidd, Charles, Williamson, David (editors). ''Debrett's Peerage and Baronetage'' (1990 edition). New York: St Martin's Press, 1990, {{Page needed |date=February 2013}} *{{Rayment|date=February 2012}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Moran, Baron}} [[Category:Baronies in the Peerage of the United Kingdom]]
